title: Using Micron Technology's (Ticker: MU) financials from its FY2024 Form 10-K, what is the company’s EV/EBITDA (rounded to 2 decimals) on August 29th, 2024, using Enterprise Value in $B (rounded to 2 decimals) and EBITDA in $B (rounded to 2 decimals)?
description:
1) Extract FY2024 operating income (EBIT) and D&A from Micron’s FY2024 Form 10-K. Operating Income = $1.304B. Depreciation and amortization = $7.780B. 
 
 2) Compute EBITDA using formula: EBITDA = Operating income + Depreciation & amortization = $1.304 + $7.780 = $9.08B (rounded to 2 decimals)
 
 3) Pull FY2024 balance-sheet items from the FY2024 10-K: Cash & equivalents = $7.041B ; Short-term investments = $1.065B; Current debt = $0.431B; Long-term debt = $12.966B
 
 4) Pull FY2024 shares outstanding (as of August 29, 2024): Shares outstanding = 1,109 million. 
 
 5) Retrieve MU’s closing share price on Aug 29, 2024: found $96.24 per share (USD)
 
 6) Calculate market capitalization on Aug 29, 2024 for equity value for EV equation: Price × Shares outstanding = $96.24 × 1,109,000,000 = $106,730,160,000 ≈ $106.73B.
 
 7) Compute Enterprise Value (EV): EV = Equity Value + Total debt - Cash & cash equivalents. Total debt = $12.966B + $0.431B = $13.397B. Cash + short-term investments = $7.041B + $1.065B = $8.106B. EV = $106.73B + $13.397B - $8.106B = $112.02B (rounded to 2 decimals).
 
 8) Compute EV/EBITDA and round to two decimals: EV/EBITDA = $112.02B / $9.08B = 12.34×.

rubric.criteria: Use EBITDA formula: EBITDA = Operating income + D&A. EBITDA = $1.304B + $7.780B = $9.08B.
Closing share price on August 29, 2024 = $96.24 per share (USD)
Market capitalization = Equity value = price x shares = 1,109 million x 96.24 = $106.73B.
Total debt = $13.397B (sum of long-term and current debt)
Cash + short-term investments = $8.106B (sum of cash and short-term investments)
